snippet: The prospective penalty would be smaller than the $340 million the British bank had to pay a New York State regulator to settle a money laundering case.
abstract: Treasury Dept recommends a preliminary settlement with Standard Chartered, clearing the way for the British bank to pay a penalty to state and federal prosecutors and to move beyond claims that it flouted laws governing international money transfers; penalty would be smaller than the $340 million it had to pay a New York State regulator to settle a money laundering case.
lead_paragraph: The prospective penalty would be smaller than the $340 million the British bank had to pay a New York State regulator to settle a money laundering case.

headline.seo: Treasury Backs Plan for Standard Chartered Settlement
headline.main: Treasury Backs Plan for Standard Chartered Settlement
headline.print_headline: Treasury Backs Preliminary Deal Penalizing Bank
